snippet: The five broadcast networks sold an estimated $9 billion worth of commercial time before the season starts, about the same or a little less than last year’s sales.
abstract: Advertising column discusses flat performance of broadcast networks in selling commercial time ahead of 2013-2014 television season; five broadcast networks sold estimated $9 billion worth of commercial time prior to start of season, about same or slightly less than last year’s sales; cable channels are faring better in upfront markets.

byline.original: By STUART ELLIOTT and BRIAN STELTER

lead_paragraph: The five broadcast networks sold an estimated $9 billion worth of commercial time before the season starts, about the same or a little less than last year’s sales.

headline.main: Advance Ad Sales for New TV Season Called Lukewarm
headline.print_headline: Advance Ad Sales for New TV Season Are Lukewarm as Audiences Slip
